br.com.caelum.vraptor.core

Class ExceptionRecorder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.caelum.vraptor.core.ExceptionRecorder<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MethodInvocation<T>

    public class ExceptionRecorder<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements MethodInvocation<T>
    Create proxies to store state of exception mapping.

    This class is a part of Exception Handling Feature.

    Since:
    3.2
    Author:
    Ot√°vio Scherer Garcia, Lucas Cavalcanti
    See Also:
    ExceptionRecorderParameter, ExceptionMapper, DefaultExceptionMapper, ExceptionHandlerInterceptor

      • intercept

        public java.lang.Object intercept(T proxy,
                         java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                         java.lang.Object[] args,
                         SuperMethod superMethod)
        Description copied from interface: MethodInvocation
        Executes for all method invocations on proxies.
        Specified by:
        intercept in interface MethodInvocation<T>
        Parameters:
        proxy - that received the method call.
        method - called.
        args - given to the method call.
        superMethod - allowing calls to the overriden original method. A super method call only makes sense for concrete class proxies.
        Returns:
        the method call return.

        public void replay(Result result)
